document.p: The Wi-Fi Channel section on the Wi-Fi page groups the following settings:
document.li1:
Frequency Band:
The frequency band used by the access point.

MAC Address:
The unique hexadecimal code that identifies a device on a network. Each network-enabled device has at least one unique MAC address.

Standard:
The standards that are allowed for Wi-Fi communication. Only devices that support one of the selected modes can connect to the .

Channel:
The Wi-Fi channel that is currently used for Wi-Fi communication. The default setting is Automatic, the automatically selects the best channel for your Wi-Fi communication. We recommend you not to change this setting.

Region:
The region in which the Wi-Fi access point is used.
